channel.title: Timeline of the City's History: 1871 on Homicide in Chicago 1870-1930
channel.description: Recent content in Timeline of the City's History: 1871 on Homicide in Chicago 1870-1930

item.title: Kerfoot's
item.description: Kerfoot’s ‘Business Block,’ erected by Mr. W.D. Kerfoot and his clerk at Washington and La Salle Streets on the day after the Great Fire is the office where until recently was the Chamber of Commerce Building, the home of the Chicago Real Estate Board. From left to right: Alexander Wolcott, Emil Rudolph, Geo. Birkhoff, Jr (above), Wm. D. Kerfoot (below), W. A. Merigold, Sam Ashton Courtesy of “Chicago and Its Makers” (Chicago: Felix Mendelsohn, 1929).

item.title: Map of Burnt District
item.description: Map of Burnt District in the Great Fire, 1871. Courtesy of “Chicago and Its Makers” (Chicago: Felix Mendelsohn, 1929). Other images from this year

item.title: Michigan Avenue at Adams Street Immediately after the Fire
item.description: The temporary frame buildings erected for business purposes on the east side of the Avenue. Courtesy of “Chicago and Its Makers” (Chicago: Felix Mendelsohn, 1929). Other images from this year

item.title: Ruins from Lake Street Looking Northeast
item.description: South Water Street is in the center. Courtesy of “Chicago and Its Makers” (Chicago: Felix Mendelsohn, 1929). Other images from this year

item.title: The Courthouse Ruins
item.description: The ruins of the Courthouse, after the Great Fire of 1871. Courtesy of “Chicago and Its Makers” (Chicago: Felix Mendelsohn, 1929). Other images from this year

item.title: The Grand Pacific Hotel Ruins
item.description: The ruins of the Grand Pacific Hotel after the Great Fire of 1871. Courtesy of “Chicago and Its Makers” (Chicago: Felix Mendelsohn, 1929). Other images from this year
